intro: Packera ionophylla, commonly known as the Ionophylla paintbrush, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its showy, yellow to orange flower heads. The plant typically grows in alpine and subalpine regions, thriving in rocky and open habitats. Its leaves are generally basal, with a rough, hairy texture, and the flowers are arranged in dense, cylindrical clusters. Packera ionophylla plays an important role in pollination and is a valuable component of high-altitude ecosystems.
